post.summary: Add or remove user provided tags on a task.
Add a custom task history message. History messages are autogenerated for all task changes except to data and metadata
Add a list of strings to tag the task with. Meant to be human readable / UI visible.
Allow many commands to be run for any number of tasks in one request
Change the position of a subtask in its parent's subtask list
A list of KeyValue pairs of arbitrary task specific data.
A list of KeyValue pairs of info about the task. Task scoping is stored as metadata as well as each part of your contextual namespace
Aggregate data about tasks. Accepts multiple requests at once and returns the corresponding results as a series of lists

Get multiple tasks - if exclude_deleted is true deleted tasks are removed from the response, not just replaced
with nil. Order still preserved.
Get a task and all of it's subtasks
Aggregate multiple search requests into a singular response
Search for tasks based on provided filters

filters.title: Fields that can be used to control and narrow the data used for metrics

values.description: List of values associated with the key.

key.title: String key associated with the values

identity.title: Information about the task that that was passed into the request

persona.title: persona type of user who added the conversation

key.title: The value of a field for a given metric

count.title: The number of tasks with a field value that matches key

v1CountMetricResponse.title: A metric response that contains the number of tasks with a given value for a field

identity.title: The namespace, parent path, and task id of the task you are deleting

namespace.title: The task's scope. Should be contextual, separated by '/'. e.g. partner/ABC/account-group/AG-123

taskId.title: The unique id of the new task

status.title: The initial state of the task

dueDate.title: When the task should be done by

tags.title: Task label used to organize or convey information about a task. e.g. "Approved", "Feedback Provided"

notes.title: Free form information about the task

taskType.title: The what type of task this is. e.g. "Review", "Social Post"

data.title: Extra data to store on the task

metadata.description: Data about the task. The task's namespace will automatically be split apart and stored in this field.

customTags.title: User defined tags used to filter task searches

callerSubjectId.title: The subject id of the user performing this action

assignees.title: Assignee to search on. Multiple assignees will return tasks that have at least one of the specified assignees

rangeStart.title: Search tasks that have a due date or completion_date after the specified time

rangeEnd.title: Search tasks that have a due date or completion_date before the specified time

types.description: Type of tasks to return. Returns tasks that match at least one of the specified types.

tags.title: Search tasks tagged with these tags. Returns tasks that match at least one tag

metadata.description: Search on key value metadata. Useful for searching on part of your namespace or task scope.

dateRangeField.title: Which field to range over for range_start and range_end

access.title: Which users have access to a task

metadataGroups.title: Groups of metadata that will OR together (all data within each group will be AND'ed)

requests.title: Requests for each Metric to be returned

metrics.title: List of the metric type being returned

responses.title: MetricResponses contains the results of the aggregation

names.title: The provided names of each requested metric

v1GetMetricsResponse.title: Returns a list of responses where each response, name and metric correspond sequentially to a requested metric

identity.title: The specific task to retrieve

returnDeleted.description:
Deleted tasks will be returned regardless of this field (and it never was functional).
To not have deleted tasks returned use the exclude_deleted field.

v1GetTasksRequest.title: GetTasksRequest is the request message for GetMulti

v1GetTasksResponse.title: GetTasksResponse is the response message for GetMulti

identity.title: The root of the task tree to be returned

v1GetTreeRequest.title: GetTreeRequest is the request message for GetTree

user.title: The user that did the action

v1Metric.title:
- METRIC_NAMESPACE: The number of tasks for each different namespace
 - METRIC_TYPE: The number of tasks for each task type
 - METRIC_TAG: The number of tasks for each tag
 - METRIC_STATUS: The number of tasks for each status
 - METRIC_ASSIGNEE: The number of tasks for each assignee
 - METRIC_OLDEST_DUE_DATE: The oldest due date on a task for each type
 - METRIC_STATUS_PER_TYPE: The number of tasks with each different status for each type
 - METRIC_TYPE_PER_ASSIGNEE: The number of tasks in each type for all assignees
 - METRIC_STATUS_PER_ASSIGNEE_PER_TYPE: The number of tasks with a certain status for an assignee for a type
 - METRIC_UNUSED: As of proto 3.3(which we are on at the time of this comment) the reserved keyword is not supported inside an enum
so this no longer used enum value must exist
 - METRIC_STATUS_PER_ASSIGNEE: The number of tasks in each status per assignee
 - METRIC_PARTNER: The number of tasks for each partner
 - METRIC_PER_DAY: The number of tasks for an assignee broken down per day
 - METRIC_FULFILLING_PARTNER: The number of tasks for each fulfilling partner
 - METRIC_TYPE_PER_DAY: The number of tasks for each type broken down per day
 - METRIC_TAG_PER_DAY: The number of tasks for a tag broken down per day
 - METRIC_COUNT_BY_DATE_RANGE: Count the number of tasks on a specified range
 - METRIC_TASKS_COMPLETED_BY_DELAY: Aggregate number of tasks based on the difference between completion and due dates
 - METRIC_TASKS_OVERDUE_BY_DELAY: Aggregate number of tasks based on the difference between completion and due dates

v1MetricResponses.title: The results for all metrics requested in GetMetrics

assignees.title: Assignee to search on. Multiple assignees will return tasks that have at least one of the specified assignees

rangeStart.title: Search tasks that have a due date after the specified time

rangeEnd.title: Search tasks that have a due date before the specified time

types.description: Type of tasks to return. Returns tasks that match at least one of the specified types.

tags.title: Search tasks tagged with these tags. Returns tasks that match at least one tag

metadata.description: Search on key value metadata. Useful for searching on part of your namespace or task scope.

cursor.title: An offset to start returning tasks from

pageSize.title: The number of tasks to be returned

sortField.title: What field to sort results on

sortDirection.title: Whether or not to sort results ascending or descending

dateRangeField.title: Which field to range over for range_start and range_end

access.title: Which users have access to a task

sorts.title: The fields and directions to sort the results on. List order will be used for precedence

excludeHistory.description: Whether or not to exclude history from the search response. This can help with large message size issues.

deletedOnly.title: Whether to show only deleted tasks in the search response

tagGroups.title: Groups of tags to OR together (the tags within each group are AND'ed)

metadataGroups.title: Groups of metadata that will OR together (all data within each group will be AND'ed)

taskId.title: Exact match task ID. Useful if the ID is known but the namespace or parent path are uncertain

customTags.title: User defined custom tags. If specified will return tasks that match ALL provided tags

v1SearchTaskRequest.title: Request to search tasks with optional fields to search on

tasks.title: The list of tasks returned from this search request

nextCursor.title: The cursor to send with the next search request

hasMore.title: If there is another batch of results to be returned

hits.title: Total number of tasks that match the search criteria
